content.text:
## Analysis of the Main Target Image

The target structure consists of 4 building blocks arranged in 2 layers:

**Layer 1 (Bottom):**
- Two red arch-shaped blocks that form the base of the structure
- These blocks have arches/tunnels running through them
- They are positioned side by side, creating a support system

**Layer 2 (Top):**
- One yellow rectangular block positioned horizontally on top of the red blocks
- One yellow semi-cylindrical block attached to the end of the rectangular block

**Spatial Relationships:**
- The two red blocks on the bottom layer are positioned parallel to each other
- The yellow rectangular block rests horizontally across the top of both red blocks
- The yellow semi-cylindrical block is placed at the right end of the rectangular block

## Selection of Required Blocks from Dictionary

Based on my analysis of the target structure, these are the blocks needed:

1. Red arch block with opening on one side (Index 1)
2. Red arch block with opening on one side (Index 2)
3. Yellow rectangular block (Index 10)
4. Yellow semi-cylindrical block (Index 11)

## Assembly Order

```
{
    Step1: Move block with index 1
    Step2: Move block with index 2
    Step3: Move block with index 10
    Step4: Move block with index 11
}
```

This assembly sequence places the two red arch blocks first to create the base, then adds the yellow rectangular block across them, and finally places the yellow semi-cylindrical block on top of the rectangular block to complete the structure.
